articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration said on Wednesday night that a PSA Airlines regional jet collided midair with a Sikorsky H-60 helicopter while on approach to Reagan Washington National Airport.
articles.title: Regional jet collides with helicopter near Washington's Reagan Airport

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Militants from Hamas and allied groups Islamic Jihad and Popular Resistance Committees arrived at a site in Khan Younis in Gaza ahead of the handover of Israeli hostages on Thursday Hamas sources and witnesses said, as part of a ceasefire deal.
articles.title: Palestinian militants arrive at Gaza site before hostage handover, militant sources and witnesses say

articles.author: Jacob Gronholt-Pedersen, Gwladys Fouche
articles.description: In 2023, Mads Petersen, owner of Greenland-based startup Arctic Unmanned, sat in a car to keep warm while he tested a small drone at minus 43 degrees Celsius (minus 45 degrees Fahrenheit).
articles.title: ‘We’re all having to catch up’: NATO scrambles for drones that can survive the Arctic

articles.author: Yassin Kombi, Sonia Rolley
articles.description: Rwandan President Paul Kagame blasted criticism of his country's role in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo where rebels his government backs have seized its largest city, saying Kigali is prepared for "confrontation" if necessary.
articles.title: Rwanda's Kagame defiant on criticism of east Congo offensive; rebels push south

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma, Shivam Patel
articles.description: Police said 30 people were killed in the crush at the world's biggest gathering of humanity, but sources told Reuters the death toll was nearly 40.
articles.title: India orders probe into Kumbh festival stampede that killed dozens

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Air traffic control audio recorded the moments before and after an American Airlines regional passenger jet crashedwith a U.S. Army Black Hawk helicopter in a midair collision over Washington on Wednesday night.
articles.title: Air traffic controller audio captures moments before and after Washington plane crash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French far-right leader Marine Le Pen said France should follow U.S. President Donald Trump's hardline stance toward countries unwilling to receive deportees, citing his pressure on Colombia as a model for Paris' dealings with Algeria.
articles.title: France should follow Trump's Colombia example in dealing with deportees, Le Pen says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain has warned Rwanda that its involvement in an escalating conflict in the Democratic Republic of Congo could jeopardise the over $1 billion of aid it receives every year.
articles.title: UK warns Rwanda of threat to aid over its involvement in DRC conflict

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma, Shivam Patel
articles.description: Moments before a deadly stampede at the world's biggest religious gathering in India, Hindu devotees queuing to take a spiritual bath in a river said they pleaded with police to open barricaded routes to thin out a surging crowd.
articles.title: Moments before deadly stampede at India's Maha Kumbh, devotees pleaded to open more routes

articles.author: Shoon Naing, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: Four years after seizing power in a dawn coup that ousted an elected civilian government, Myanmar's embattled ruling generals are making their most concerted effort to gain legitimacy - by pushing to hold another election.
articles.title: Risk of violence escalates in Myanmar's civil war as junta flags elections
